events.message: Customer reported a rear-end collision involving their car on the highway during rush hour. Initial claim has been registered.
The claim was categorized under auto accident after reviewing the initial report mentioning vehicle damage and collision impact.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to handle further communications and support the claimant with all steps.
Customer received an official acknowledgement of the claim submission and was informed about the next steps in the process.
Request sent to the customer for the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and insurance policy documents.
Customer submitted all requested documents including the police accident report and multiple photos showing the collision damages.
Investigation into the circumstances of the auto accident began, including verification of submitted documents and damage assessment.
Completed investigation confirmed liability and extent of damages consistent with the provided evidence and police report.
A settlement amount was proposed to the customer for repairs and related costs, based on damage evaluation and policy coverage.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the claim process so far.
The claim was formally approved, confirming agreement on settlement terms and readiness for payment issuance.
Settlement payment was issued to the customerâ€™s bank account to cover vehicle repair expenses following claim approval.
The auto accident claim was successfully closed after payment issuance and confirmation that all customer concerns were resolved.
All relevant records and documentation of the claim were archived in the system for future reference and audit purposes.
